questions.question_text:
A company needs to optimize the cost of its compute resources.

Which type of workload should the company run on Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances?

choices.D: A short-term workload that cannot be interrupted
choices.C: A steady-state workload that does not require a long-term commitment
choices.A: A steady-state workload that requires a particular EC2 instance configuration for a long period of time
choices.B: A short-term workload that can be interrupted

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. A steady-state workload that requires a particular EC2 instance configuration for a long period of time

A. A steady-state workload that requires a particular EC2 instance configuration for a long period of time should be run on Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances to optimize cost. Reserved Instances offer significant discounts over On-Demand instances, making them a cost-effective choice for steady-state workloads that require a long-term commitment.

Selected Answer: A
A. A steady-state workload that requires a particular EC2 instance configuration for a long period of time.

Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances are ideal for workloads that require a specific instance type and are expected to run for a long time. They offer a significant discount compared to On-Demand instances, making them cost-effective for steady-state workloads that can be planned in advance. They are not suitable for short-term workloads that can be interrupted or stopped, as the discount is applied only for instances that are running for the entire duration of the reservation.

questions.question_text: Which AWS service provides a highly accurate and easy-to-use enterprise search service that is powered by machine learning (ML)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Amazon Kendra

"Amazon Kendra is an intelligent search service that uses natural language processing and advanced machine learning algorithms to return specific answers to search questions from your data. Unlike traditional keyword-based search, Amazon Kendra uses its semantic and contextual understanding capabilities to decide whether a document is relevant to a search query. It returns specific answers to questions, giving users an experience that's close to interacting with a human expert."

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kendra/latest/dg/what-is-kendra.html

Selected Answer: A
Amazon Kendra is an enterprise search service provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). It is designed to make it easy for organizations to implement powerful search functionality for their internal data and documents.

A. Amazon Kendra is a highly accurate and easy-to-use enterprise search service that is powered by machine learning (ML). It uses ML algorithms to understand natural language queries and provides relevant search results based on the context of the query. It can index data from various sources such as databases, websites, and file systems, and provide a unified search experience across all of them.

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A. Amazon Kendra.

Amazon Kendra is an AWS service that provides a highly accurate and easy-to-use enterprise search service that is powered by machine learning (ML). It uses natural language processing (NLP) and other ML techniques to understand the context and intent of user queries, enabling it to deliver highly relevant search results. Amazon Kendra can index a wide variety of data sources, including databases, file systems, and websites, and it supports a range of query types, including natural language queries, keyword queries, and Boolean queries. It is designed to be easy to set up and use, and it provides a range of features, including faceted search, type-ahead suggestions, and document ranking.

Selected Answer: C
C. Economies of scale

"Benefit from massive economies of scale â€“ By using cloud computing, you can achieve a lower variable cost than you can get on your own. Because usage from hundreds of thousands of customers is aggregated in the cloud, providers such as AWS can achieve higher economies of scale, which translates into lower pay as-you-go prices."

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

C. Economies of scale refer to the cost advantage experienced by a company when it increases its output. The same principle applies to AWS since it has a large user base that generates significant demand for cloud computing resources. AWS can take advantage of this by purchasing and operating resources in bulk, which results in lower costs per unit. AWS passes these savings on to customers in the form of lower prices, making it an attractive option for companies looking to optimize their usage costs.

Selected Answer: C
The benefit of the AWS Cloud that helps companies achieve lower usage costs because of the aggregate usage of all AWS users is "Economies of scale"

questions.question_text: Which benefit of the AWS Cloud helps companies achieve lower usage costs because of the aggregate usage of all AWS users?
Which AWS service or feature is associated with a subnet in a VPC and is used to control inbound and outbound traffic?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B for sure

Selected Answer: B
B. Network ACLs

B. Network ACLs are associated with a subnet in a VPC and are used to control inbound and outbound traffic. Amazon Inspector is a security assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS. AWS Shield is a managed DDoS protection service for web applications. VPC Flow Logs capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in a VPC.

Selected Answer: B
A subnet in a VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) is an isolated segment of an AWS network where a user can launch AWS resources in a defined virtual network. Network Access Control Lists (NACLs) are associated with subnets in a VPC and provide a firewall-like protection layer to control inbound and outbound traffic from and to the subnet. NACLs operate at the subnet level, allowing or denying traffic to and from the subnets in a VPC based on rules that can be configured to specify the allowed source and destination IP addresses, protocols, and ports. VPC security groups, on the other hand, are associated with AWS resources such as EC2 instances, and they control the traffic that is allowed to reach a particular resource, rather than to an entire subnet.

questions.question_text:
A company needs to securely store important credentials that an application uses to connect users to a database.

Which AWS service can meet this requirement with the MINIMAL amount of operational overhead?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. AWS Secrets Manager

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/latest/userguide/intro.html

C. AWS Secrets Manager is designed specifically for storing and managing secrets, such as database credentials, and provides a simple way to manage these secrets and automatically rotate them. It integrates with other AWS services and provides a minimal amount of operational overhead, reducing the need for custom code or manual management of secrets. AWS KMS is a key management service, which is used to create and manage encryption keys, while AWS Config is a service that provides detailed inventory, configuration history, and configuration change notifications for AWS resources. Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior.

Selected Answer: C
AWS Secrets Manager can meet this requirement with the minimal amount of operational overhead. AWS Secrets Manager helps to protect access to applications, services, and IT resources. It enables the storage and management of credentials, such as database credentials, API keys, and other secrets, through a fully managed service that can simplify their rotation, management, and retrieval.
